title: what portable tool works well to resize partitions?

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content:
I dont know if this is the best spot to ask but it is needed for a usb boot xp.  

I need to be able to resize ntfs partitions from my usboot xp os.  

what is a good free/shareware tool for this?  

thanks

forumNotes.author: Agent47
forumNotes.content:
Partition Wizard Home edition works fine in portable mode.Install it in a regular OS and then copy the installed directory to USB drive. Works fine for me.

[http://www.partition...on-manager.html](http://www.partitionwizard.com/free-partition-manager.htmlhttp://www.partitionwizard.com/free-partition-manager.html "External link")

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content:
thanks, I tried it and it works but is very bloated. I found AOMEI Partition Assistant Home Edition and its much smaller.  

Im still curious if there is a single self exicutable .exe that will work for resizing only?

forumNotes.author: Agent47
forumNotes.content: Yes, PartitionGuru is a wonderful tool with so many features. There is a free version which can be run from dos and it's Windows part is also compatible to operate under Win7PE SE. Their paid version is the most complete partition tool i have ever seen.
